instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after about 2 minutes
threads.message:
Clean board, restoring T2 took several attempts but finally it worked, now when trying to install OS or entering recovery mode the Mac shuts down after about 2 minutes.

SSD power rails are present and steady.

<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_IO_SSD0</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>

Could this be a dying NAND?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after about 2 minutes
threads.message: Change security settings to allow USB boot and test with external macOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after about 2 minutes
threads.message: When trying to boot into recovery the Mac shuts down and when I try to hold option to select a different disk the Mac restarts constantly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shuts down after about 2 minutes
threads.message: Tried with known good battery connected, and original 87W charger?
